column5: Magnificent reports, as always.  Interesting that you say braid got outfished 10-1.  Hard to believe they care even up there  thanks

.Interesting that you say braid got outfished 10-1.  Hard to believe they care even up there  It is the only place I have ever experienced that, and it happened twice.. that's two trips.  Can't explain.  Probably the best numbers walleye fishery I've ever fished. Those eyes just liked the mono better.

Thx for posting. AN interesting glimpse into the real North.  You don't realize how massive those canoes are until you see a picture like the one at the end of report 2. Enjoyed seeing the pictures of your camps as well.
Great story telling with great pics along too. Like a really good book, had to keep reading until the end. I'm very envious of your experiences. Thanks for sharing.
I don't recognize the young guy in those pics!

You lead a charmed life sir, your stories make me feel like any excuse for not moving to better fishing is feeble and weak. I take what you say as inspiration to better myself as a fisherman and make my fishing goals happen. Thank you
I don't recognize the young guy in those pics!  Cutest little baby face.  Great stuff Bunk. Thanks.

from what you said about Joe and Reg, I remember getting to fish with John Ritch for an afternoon, on his home lake (Ogoki), he didn't talk a lot, but I hung on to every word he said, magical!  he trolled jigs too  you're a living legend for people who like to fish in northern Ontario Moosebunk
Wow!  That is awesome!  Thanx - I love reading your posts.
Awesome stories as usual bunk. Some serious adventures there!
You are an adventurer. Wow. I love your photography.

I don't recognize the young guy in those pics!   Cutest little baby face.   You're kinda right but c'mon guys!?!?    29 ish then, chubby cheeked but fit... (dude, dude)  Only a few years now the greys have been popping up in the beard but, still good to go... Good times in the north.  Chris... a decade worth of those stories, so many people's personal accounts of life in and connected to the bush... it doesn't grow old hearing more.  Big thanks... and bigger canoes.    Yes.
Wow what a great adventure bunk thanks for sharing I really enjoy reading your reports and the photos are awesome looking forward to your next journey.  Cheers Mitch...
Great read on something very few people will ever get to experience, thanks for taking the time to share!  -AA
